title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 §§ 143-2.2 - Names of debtors that are organizations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 §§ 143-2.2 - Names of debtors that are organizations

State Regulations
(a) Organization name field. The names of
organizations are stored in files that include only the names of organizations, and not the names of individuals. A single field is used to store an
organization name. (b) Truncation -
organization names. The organization name field in the UCC database is fixed in
length. The length of the data entry field in the central filing office is 200
characters. Although filers should continue to provide full names on their UCC
documents, a name that exceeds the fixed length is entered as presented to the
filing officer, up to the maximum length of the data entry field. (c) The central filing office may from time
to time specify the maximum number of characters that may be contained in the
fields of a UCC document transmitted to the central filing office by XML
transmission or by any other electronic delivery method. The number so
specified by the central filing office for the name field of an organization
may be less than, equal to or greater than the number specified in subdivision
(b) of this section. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19
§§
143-2.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
